newsitem.title: UK: OPTIONS - B.A.T Inds continues active.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS - B.A.T Inds continues active.

text.p: Options in B.A.T Industries Plc continued active on Friday after a week in which the stock hit a four-month high amid demerger talk and as some investment funds bought stocks which had underperformed for much of the year.
Options specialists reported a call spread trade involving a sale of the January 460p calls and a purchase of the January 500p calls.
They said there had also been a buyer of 200 January 500p puts and a seller of 400 of the January 460p puts.
The stock was down 2-1/2p at 491 by 1610 GMT in active trade of 15 million shares.
In ASDA Group Plc ASSD.L, dealers highlighted a purchase of 600 July 120p calls in the stock, which was up 1/2p at 121-3/4 in heavy trading of 16.1 million shares.

And British Gas Plc was also active after a volatile week for the stock, partly due to a Financial Times report that major investment institutions were seriously underweight in the shares and would be looking to top up their holdings.
Dealers said 1,000 of the March 240p calls had been crossed at 9p.
